column1: Rent control. North Carolina legislation currently prohibits rent control on both a state and local level. Thus, landlords can charge as much as they want for rent.
Rent increases. North Carolina landlords can raise tenantsâ€™ rent for whatever reason without prior notice.

Additional fees. North Carolina landlords may charge up to $15 of 5% of monthly rent in late fees for month-to-month renters, and 4$ of 5% of rent for week-to-week renters. Landlords cannot charge more than $25 for returned check fees.
